apiVersions.description:
Configure a fixed list of API versions to pass to 'helm
template' via the --api-versions flag with the below:

environments.description: The list of environments managed by helmfile.

releases.description:
Helmfile runs various helm commands to converge the current
state in the live cluster to the desired state defined here.

historyMax.description:
limit the maximum number of revisions saved per release. Use 0
for no limit.

devel.description:
if used with charts museum allows to pull unstable charts for
deployment, for example: if 1.2.3 and 1.2.4-dev versions exist
and set to true, 1.2.4-dev will be pulled (default false)

skipDeps.description:
When set to `true`, skips running `helm dep up` and `helm dep
build` on this release's chart.

mergeValues.description: Merges passed values with namespace's defaults if true, overrides if false

annotations.description: Add annotations to resources on this release

resourceLabels.description: Adds labels to resources on this release

labels.description: Adds helmfile labels to this release

chartVersion.description: Specify a specific chart version to use for this release

chartUrl.description: Override this release's chart URL (i.e: an absolute like /path/to/chart.tgz or /path/to/chart_dir. Or a remote like git::https://github.com/bitnami/charts.git@bitnami/apache?ref=main)

values.description: Pass values to the release helm chart

kubeVersion.description: Specifies the kubernetes API version, useful in helm templating environment

targetNamespace.description: Sets the cluster namespace in which the releases will be deployed

annotations.description: Add annotations to release resources on this namespace

resourceLabels.description: Adds labels to release resources on this namespace

labels.description: Adds helmfile labels to releases on this namespace

historyMax.description:
limit the maximum number of revisions saved per release. Use 0
for no limit.

enum: This *Namespace* provides a suitable stack to operate Arbitrum One mainnet, g√∂rli and sepolia archive nodes.

Nitro is the latest iteration of the Arbitrum technology. It is a fully integrated, complete layer 2 optimistic rollup system, including fraud proofs, the sequencer, the token bridges, advanced calldata compression, and more.
Proxyd is an EVM-blockchain JSON-RPC router and load balancer developed in Go by Optimism. It is capable of load balancing, automatic failover, intelligent request routing and very basic caching.
Proxyd is an EVM-blockchain JSON-RPC router and load balancer developed in Go by Optimism. It is capable of load balancing, automatic failover, intelligent request routing and very basic caching.

namespaces.arbitrumOne.flavor.mainnet.description: suitable defaults for an arbitrum-one-mainnet archive node

namespaces.arbitrumOne.flavor.sepolia.description: suitable defaults for an arbitrum-one-sepolia archive node

deployments.description: number of independent stateful sets to deploy

enum: This *Namespace* provides a suitable stack to operate Celo mainnet archive nodes.
Official golang implementation of the Celo blockchain
Proxyd is an EVM-blockchain JSON-RPC router and load balancer developed in Go by Optimism. It is capable of load balancing, automatic failover, intelligent request routing and very basic caching.

namespaces.celo.flavor.alfajores.description: suitable defaults for an alfajores archive node

namespaces.celo.flavor.baklava.description: suitable defaults for a baklava archive node

namespaces.celo.flavor.mainnet.description: suitable defaults for a mainnet archive node

deployments.description: number of independent stateful sets to deploy

startP2PPort.description: A beggining port for the range to use in P2P NodePorts

enum: This *Namespace* provides a suitable stack to operate Ethereum mainnet, g√∂erli, holesky and sepolia archive nodes.
Erigon is an implementation of Ethereum (execution client with light client for consensus layer), on the efficiency frontier.
Nimbus-eth2 is an extremely efficient consensus layer (eth2) client implementation.
Proxyd is an EVM-blockchain JSON-RPC router and load balancer developed in Go by Optimism. It is capable of load balancing, automatic failover, intelligent request routing and very basic caching.

namespaces.ethereum.flavor.goerli.description: suitable defaults for a g√∂erli archive node

namespaces.ethereum.flavor.holesky.description: suitable defaults for a hole≈õky ethereum testnet node

namespaces.ethereum.flavor.mainnet.description: suitable defaults for a mainnet archive node

namespaces.ethereum.flavor.sepolia.description: suitable defaults for a sepolia ethereum testnet node

deployments.description: number of independent stateful sets to deploy

startP2PPort.description: A beggining port for the range to use in P2P NodePorts

enum: This *Namespace* provides a suitable stack to operate Gnosis mainnet archive nodes.
Erigon is an implementation of Ethereum (execution client with light client for consensus layer), on the efficiency frontier.
An open-source Ethereum consensus client, written in Rust and maintained by Sigma Prime.
Proxyd is an EVM-blockchain JSON-RPC router and load balancer developed in Go by Optimism. It is capable of load balancing, automatic failover, intelligent request routing and very basic caching.

namespaces.gnosis.flavor.chiado.description: suitable defaults for a chiado testnet archive node

namespaces.gnosis.flavor.mainnet.description: suitable defaults for a mainnet archive node

deployments.description: number of independent stateful sets to deploy

startP2PPort.description: A beggining port for the range to use in P2P NodePorts

enum:
This *Namespace* provides the necessary software to run a Graph Node and participate
in the Graph Protocol Network
Graph Node is an open source Rust implementation that event sources the Ethereum blockchain to deterministically update a data store that can be queried via the GraphQL endpoint.
Utility kit for interacting and managing the Graph indexer stack.
Manage Raw Kubernetes Resources using Helm
Manage Raw Kubernetes Resources using Helm
Gossip about Subgraphs with other Graph Protocol Indexers

namespaces.graph.flavor.arbitrum_one.description: suitable defaults for an arbitrum-one indexer

namespaces.graph.flavor.arbitrum_sepolia.description: suitable defaults for an arbitrum-one indexer

namespaces.graph.flavor.mainnet.description: suitable defaults for a mainnet indexer

enum: This *Namespace* adds ingress support and certificate management on kubernetes
ingress-nginx is an Ingress controller for Kubernetes using NGINX as a reverse proxy and load balancer.
cert-manager adds certificates and certificate issuers as resource types in Kubernetes clusters, and simplifies the process of obtaining, renewing and using those certificates.
Manage Raw Kubernetes Resources using Helm
This *Namespace* adds software for log and metrics collection and visualization, as well as alarmistic.
Installs the kube-prometheus stack, a collection of Kubernetes manifests, Grafana dashboards, and Prometheus rules
This chart installs a node-problem-detector daemonset. This tool aims to make various node problems visible to the upstream layers in cluster management stack.
Helm chart for Grafana Loki in microservices mode
Promtail is an agent which ships the contents of local logs to a Loki instance

namespaces.monitoring.features.logs.description: logs: add Loki and promtail for logging

namespaces.monitoring.features.metrics.description: metrics: add kube-prometheus stack and node-problem-detector

enum: This *Namespace* provides a suitable stack to operate Polygon mainnet archive nodes.
Erigon is an implementation of Ethereum (execution client with light client for consensus layer), on the efficiency frontier.
Proxyd is an EVM-blockchain JSON-RPC router and load balancer developed in Go by Optimism. It is capable of load balancing, automatic failover, intelligent request routing and very basic caching.

namespaces.polygon.flavor.mainnet.description: suitable defaults for a mainnet archive node

enum: This *Namespace* extends your Kubernetes cluster with custom resources for easily creating and managing Postgres databases
The Postgres Operator delivers an easy to run highly-available PostgreSQL clusters on Kubernetes (K8s) powered by Patroni.
This *Namespace* provides a Kubernetes controller and tool for one-way encrypted Secrets
Sealed Secrets are 'one-way' encrypted K8s Secrets that can be created by anyone, but can only be decrypted by the controller running in the target cluster recovering the original object.

This *Namespace* uses [OpenEBS](https://openebs.io) to provide a software defined storage layer
suitable for stateful workloads that require low-latency access to the storage.
OpenEBS is the leading open-source example of a category of cloud native storage solutions sometimes called Container Attached Storage.
Manage Raw Kubernetes Resources using Helm
CSI driver for provisioning Local PVs backed by ZFS and more.
Manage Raw Kubernetes Resources using Helm
Manage Raw Kubernetes Resources using Helm

namespaces.storage.features.rawfile.description: include the localpv-rawfile release and storageclass

namespaces.storage.features.zfs.description: include the localpv-zfs release and storageclass

enum: Erigon is an implementation of Ethereum (execution client with light client for consensus layer), on the efficiency frontier.
Nimbus-eth2 is an extremely efficient consensus layer (eth2) client implementation.
Proxyd is an EVM-blockchain JSON-RPC router and load balancer developed in Go by Optimism. It is capable of load balancing, automatic failover, intelligent request routing and very basic caching.
Official golang implementation of the Celo blockchain

Nitro is the latest iteration of the Arbitrum technology. It is a fully integrated, complete layer 2 optimistic rollup system, including fraud proofs, the sequencer, the token bridges, advanced calldata compression, and more.
Nethermind is a high-performance, highly configurable full Ethereum protocol execution client built on .NET that runs on Linux, Windows, and macOS, and supports Clique, Aura, and Ethash.
Manage Raw Kubernetes Resources using Helm
Graph Node is an open source Rust implementation that event sources the Ethereum blockchain to deterministically update a data store that can be queried via the GraphQL endpoint.
Utility kit for interacting and managing the Graph indexer stack.
Gossip about Subgraphs with other Graph Protocol Indexers
An open-source Ethereum consensus client, written in Rust and maintained by Sigma Prime.
ingress-nginx is an Ingress controller for Kubernetes
ingress-nginx is an Ingress controller for Kubernetes using NGINX as a reverse proxy and load balancer.
cert-manager adds certificates and certificate issuers as resource types in Kubernetes clusters, and simplifies the process of obtaining, renewing and using those certificates.
Installs the kube-prometheus stack, a collection of Kubernetes manifests, Grafana dashboards, and Prometheus rules
Delivery Hero are big fans of Kubernetes and use Helm extensively. Here we have collected a few charts that are used across our organisation.
This chart installs a node-problem-detector daemonset. This tool aims to make various node problems visible to the upstream layers in cluster management stack.
Promtail is an agent which ships the contents of local logs to a Loki instance
Helm chart for Grafana Loki in microservices mode
The Postgres Operator delivers an easy to run highly-available PostgreSQL clusters on Kubernetes (K8s) powered by Patroni.
sealed secrets chart provided by Bitnami
Sealed Secrets are 'one-way' encrypted K8s Secrets that can be created by anyone, but can only be decrypted by the controller running in the target cluster recovering the original object.

OpenEBS Helm Repository:
OpenEBS helps Developers and Platform SREs easily deploy Kubernetes Stateful Workloads that require fast and highly reliable container attached storage.
OpenEBS is the leading open-source example of a category of cloud native storage solutions sometimes called Container Attached Storage.
A Helm chart for openebs zfs localpv provisioner. This chart bootstraps OpenEBS ZFS LocalPV provisioner deployment on a Kubernetes cluster using the Helm package manager.
CSI driver for provisioning Local PVs backed by ZFS and more.
A Helm chart for OpenEBS monitoring. This chart bootstraps OpenEBS monitoring stack on a Kubernetes cluster using the Helm package manager.
A set of Grafana dashboards and Prometheus alerts for OpenEBS that can be installed as a helm chart or imported as jsonnet mixin.
